summary: This document is an email chain between legal counsel and the court in the case of US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It includes a signature block from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and discusses the filing of a joint proposed juror questionnaire, voir dire, and Jencks Act materials, with requests for sealing.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in the criminal case; her contact information appears in the signature block of the email.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330); the email is sent to her chambers.

connections.description: Sternheim, as defense counsel, is communicating with Judge Nathan's chambers regarding court filings and procedures in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Submission of Joint Proposed Juror Questionnaire
events.description: The parties submitted a joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire to the court, requesting it be filed under seal.

events.title: Government Filing and Court Request
events.description: The Government filed a letter on ECF, and the court requested a copy of Jencks Act materials and exhibits.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Bobbi C. Sternheim is identified as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the criminal case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The parties jointly proposed a juror questionnaire and voir dire, requesting it be filed under seal.
The Government produced Jencks Act material and exhibits to the defense on October 11, 2021.
Judge Alison J. Nathan is the presiding judge in the case.
The correspondence highlights procedural steps in the pre-trial phase, including sealed filings and evidence disclosure.
